articles.headline: A Rising Urgency in Israel for a Gaza Shift
articles.snippet: Consensus is emerging among some world powers and Israeli officials that attempts to weaken Hamas have failed.
articles.abstract: Consensus is emerging among some world powers and Israeli officials that attempts to weaken Hamas have failed.
articles.lead_paragraph: GAZA — Three years after Israel and Egypt imposed an embargo on this tormented Palestinian strip, shutting down its economy, a consensus has emerged that the attempt to weaken the governing party, Hamas, and drive it from power has failed.

articles.headline: Dell in Talks to Settle Intel Claims With S.E.C.
articles.snippet: The computer company and its founder, Michael S. Dell, are accused of financial irregularities stemming from dealings with the chip maker.
articles.abstract: The computer company and its founder, Michael S. Dell, are accused of financial irregularities stemming from dealings with the chip maker.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Dell said on Thursday that it was in talks with the Securities and Exchange Commission to resolve allegations that it and its founder and chief executive, Michael S. Dell, engaged in financial irregularities related to the company’s dealings with Intel.

articles.headline: Backtracking, G.M. Says Please, Call It a Chevy
articles.snippet: G.M. said the memo on the Chevy name had been “poorly worded” and called it “a rough draft” and “a bit of fun.”
articles.abstract: G.M. said the memo on the Chevy name had been “poorly worded” and called it “a rough draft” and “a bit of fun.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Responding to negative reactions to an internal memorandum discouraging use of the word Chevy, General Motors moved on Thursday to explain its strategy and to reassure consumers that it still valued the popular nickname for Chevrolet.

articles.headline: New Estimates Double Rate of Oil Flowing Into Gulf
articles.snippet: The new calculations came as public wrangling between BP and the White House was reaching new heights.
articles.abstract: The new calculations came as public wrangling between BP and the White House was reaching new heights.
articles.lead_paragraph: A government panel on Thursday essentially doubled its estimate of how much oil has been spewing from the out-of-control BP well, with the new calculation suggesting that an amount equivalent to the Exxon Valdez disaster could be flowing into the Gulf of Mexico every 8 to 10 days.
articles.byline: By Justin Gillis and Henry Fountain

articles.headline: Bringing Comparison Shopping to the Doctor’s Office
articles.snippet: A new search engine can help patients search for doctors  and find out how much they will charge, depending on their insurance coverage.
articles.abstract: A new search engine can help patients search for doctors  and find out how much they will charge, depending on their insurance coverage.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Americans comparison-shop for items as small as groceries and as big as cars. But they rarely compare prices on their health care. When a doctor recommends a test or a procedure, most patients simply go where the doctor tells them to go.

articles.headline: U.S. Fury at BP Stirs Backlash Among British
articles.snippet: In Britain, investors and politicians are becoming increasingly angry at the blistering attacks from across the Atlantic.
articles.abstract: In Britain, investors and politicians are becoming increasingly angry at the blistering attacks from across the Atlantic.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON  Spewing oil and alienating Americans with its chief executive’s impolitic remarks, BP may be Public Enemy No. 1 in the United States. But in Britain, where the company is a mainstay of the stock market and a favorite of pension funds, investors and politicians are becoming increasingly angry at the blistering attacks from across the Atlantic.
articles.byline: By Sarah Lyall and Julia Werdigier

articles.headline: Drug Maker Seen as Uncooperative on Inquiry
articles.snippet: Congressional investigators said a recall inquiry into Johnson & Johnson had been stymied by the company.
articles.abstract: Congressional investigators said a recall inquiry into Johnson & Johnson had been stymied by the company.
articles.lead_paragraph: A Congressional investigation into a recent recall of children’s Tylenol and other pediatric medicines has been stymied by the manufacturer, Johnson & Johnson, investigators say, raising the prospect that new measures  like issuing of subpoenas to compel cooperation  could be invoked.

articles.headline: In Louisville, View of Banks’ Role in the Everyday
articles.snippet: Main Street in Louisville is a visible reminder that high finance has a major presence in many communities, directly or through local relationships.
articles.abstract: Main Street in Louisville is a visible reminder that high finance has a major presence in many communities, directly or through local relationships.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  A $238 million basketball arena is rising on Main Street, financed through a bond deal underwritten by Goldman Sachs.
